Comment: You can be eligible to vote in multiple states, one state, or zero states. It's all based on the local rules of the states in question. It looks like KY is out of the question if you missed the deadline (didn't verify), so the question is whether or not you're eligible in OH, you'll just need to look into it directly. It's also possible to be eligible to vote in a state in the literal sense (registered), but not eligible to vote legally. For example, if you've moved, or if you've voted in that election in another state. It's unlikely you would be caught if you're registered to vote in Ohio and do so, but if it's criminal, that's obviously unadvisable. It just depends on their rules and your specific circumstance.
